intro: Epilobium colchicum subsp. colchicum, commonly known as the purple willow-herb, is a flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as wet meadows, stream banks, and roadside areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. It is an herbaceous perennial that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters.
